titleStmt.title: Miranda, stupenda. Or, The wonderfull and astonishing mercies which the Lord hath wrought for England, in subduing and captivating the pride, power and policy of his enemies. Presented in a sermon preached July 21. 1646. before the honorable House of Commons in Margarets Church Westm. being the day appointed for thanksgiving for the surrender of Oxford. / By Henry Wilkinson, B.D. pastor of Dunstans in the East, London, and one of the Assembly of Divines.
titleStmt.author: Wilkinson, Henry, 1610-1675.

titleStmt.title: Miranda, stupenda. Or, The wonderfull and astonishing mercies which the Lord hath wrought for England, in subduing and captivating the pride, power and policy of his enemies. Presented in a sermon preached July 21. 1646. before the honorable House of Commons in Margarets Church Westm. being the day appointed for thanksgiving for the surrender of Oxford. / By Henry Wilkinson, B.D. pastor of Dunstans in the East, London, and one of the Assembly of Divines.
titleStmt.author: Wilkinson, Henry, 1610-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.B. for Christopher Meredith and Samuel Gellibrand in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Order to print on recto of final leaf.
